item.description:
Say I have the following HTML:

<head>
    <style>
        #container {
            border: 1px red solid;
        }
        .floaty {
            width: 200px;
            float: left;
            border: 1px green solid;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
<div id='container'>
    Text inside the container
    <div class='floaty'>
    Floaty block 1<br/>
    Floaty block 1<br/>
    Floaty block 1<br/>
    </div>
    <div class='floaty'>
    Floaty block 2<br/>
    Floaty block 2<br/>
    Floaty block 2<br/>
    </div>
    <div class='floaty'>
    Floaty block 3<br/>
    Floaty block 3<br/>
    Floaty block 3<br/>
    </div>
</div>
</body>

This renders as:

What’s the proper CSS way to have the container (red-bordered box) completely surround the floaty green-bordered boxes?
